revised_title: Richard Waller: A Pivotal Figure in the Administration of the Royal Society
tldr: This article provides a detailed account of Richard Waller's life and his significant contributions to the administration of the Royal Society. Waller served as the Society's junior secretary from 1687 to 1695 and first secretary from 1695 to 1715. He played a crucial role in the Society's growth and development, overseeing the relocation of the Society's meetings and collections to Crane Court, Fleet Street. Waller was also a skilled linguist, artist, and translator, contributing to various scientific fields and publications.
